ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] OT: A Warning...
ygData.msgSnippet: Reading between the lines - I think what we may have here is yet another case of a company that can never admit they made a mistake. Many people have theorized
ygData.messageBody:
Reading between the lines - I think what we may have here is yet another
case of a company that can never admit they made a mistake.

Many people have theorized that Verant THOUGHT they were banning the author
of the rape story. If THAT story is as bad as has been implied (I haven't
read it) - I think that Verant has a case. IMHO - the issue isn't so grey
in dealing with that issue.

It wouldn't surprise me if they thought they were banning the author of that
story - and after responding "This is a private matter between Verant and
the Individual" line - they didn't want to back off - even after realizing
the banned the wrong individual...

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 05, 2000 3:11 PM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] OT: A Warning...


Hopefully someone has posted this to the FAC board. They are a group that
actively fights First Amendment Abridgements pro bono. I can't find the
link or I would post it myself. Obviously Verant has never heard of Larry
Flynt or they probably would have taken a different course in this case.

-----Original Message-----
From: Legba Work [mailto:mattdeba@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 05, 2000 2:14 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] OT: A Warning...


Yea I'm just starting to read some of this thread. Its pretty crazy. I am
not someone who really gets excited about much, but this really irks.
Enough so to consider action. The only action I can take, which is not play
EQ and not pay them any more money. Perhaps someone who enjoys doing this
should organize a protest this weekend. I might even show up for this one
:-)
